text: Ernst Dokupil (born 24 April 1947) is a retired Austrian footballer and coach. ==Career== Dokupil started his career with SC Wacker Wien and after merging for FC Admira/Wacker. After one year with 1. Simmeringer SC he went to SK Rapid Wien. In 1976 he went back to Simmering where he played two seasons. In 1978 he became coach of Simmering. In 1981 he won the 2nd league and Simmering was promoted to the Bundesliga. He then went to Admira/Wacker. From 1987 to 1989 he was coach of First Vienna FC. In 1994 he became manager of SK Rapid Wien. In his first season as coach Rapid won the Austrian Cup. The next season Rapid reached the final of the UEFA Cup Winners' Cup. In the 1997–98 he became sports director of Rapid. After Heribert Weber was fired he became again coach of Rapid for the 2000–01 season. == Honours == * 1× Austrian Champion: 1995–96 * 2× Austrian Cup: 1976 (as player), 1995 (as coach) * 1× Final of the UEFA Cup Winners' Cup: 1996 ==Other websites== * official website * Rapid Archiv Category:1947 births Category:Living people Category:Austrian footballers Category:Austrian football managers Category:FC Admira Wacker Mödling managers Category:SK Rapid Wien players Category:SK Rapid Wien managers Category:First Vienna FC managers Category:Association football midfielders Category:Austrian football champions
title: Ernst Dokupil
